original: Party B: Baidu Online Network Technology (Beijing) Co., Ltd.
ollama_generated:
Party A: [Name of Party A]

Clause:
Party A acknowledges and agrees that in the event of any claim, dispute or controversy (a "Claim") arising out of or relating to this Agreement, Party B (Baidu Online Network Technology (Beijing) Co., Ltd.) shall have the exclusive right, but not the obligation, to initiate any action or proceeding to resolve such Claim. Any resolution process initiated by Party B shall be at its sole discretion and cost. Party A hereby waives any right to bring any action or proceeding against Party B related to such a Claim without the prior written consent of Party B. This provision does not affect either party's ability to seek injunctive or other equitable relief from a court of competent jurisdiction.

original: Address: Room 2101, 12/F, Fuxing International Center, No.237, North Chaoyang Road, Chaoyang District, Beijing.
ollama_generated: Location of Records: Our office is located at Suite 2101, 12th Floor, Fuxing International Center, 237 North Chaoyang Road, Chaoyang District, Beijing. However, for purposes of flexibility and convenience, we reserve the right to store, access, and update any pertinent records electronically, with such electronic records being considered equally valid as physical ones. Any changes to our office location or primary mode of record storage will be promptly communicated to you.

original: Postcode:
ollama_generated:
Postal Code Obligation:

Upon acceptance of this Agreement, the Parties shall each promptly provide their respective postal codes to one another for the purposes of facilitating communication. In the event that either Party changes their postal code during the term of this Agreement, they shall update the other Party as soon as practicable, but in no case later than ten (10) Business Days from the date of change. Failure to do so shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement, but rather an inconvenience that may impact the efficiency of communication between the Parties. The Parties acknowledge and agree that any consequences arising from such delay shall be solely their own responsibility.

Original clause:
Postcode Obligation:
Each Party agrees to provide its respective postal code to the other Party upon acceptance of this Agreement, and each Party will promptly notify the other if its postal code changes during the term of this Agreement. If a Party fails to provide or update its postal code as required by this clause, it shall be deemed in breach of this Agreement.

ollama_generated: 1.1.5 Baidu Platform: shall refer to any and all services, applications, or domains operated by the entity known as Baidu Inc., including but not limited to www.baidu.com.

original: 1.1.6Cooperation Term: means the term set forth in Chapter 3 hereof.
ollama_generated: 1.1.6 Cooperation Term: shall be understood as referring to a duration specified within the provisions of Chapter 3 of this Agreement. However, it is noted that the parties retain the discretion to adjust or agree upon variations in the said term, subject to mutual consent.

original: 4.2.2Party A will display Party B’s “search engine box” in the first screen of the homepage of “Kingsoft Navigation” website, and imports the search results provided by Party B to the search function in the Party A’s Product by connecting its Product to the technical port provided by Party B. Party A shall also cooperate with Party B to market Baidu promotion services through the use of search engine. In other words, it is a technical service in which Party B displays the website of Party B’s clients on the relevant page of Baidu website and/or on the pages and/or interfaces of any other Baidu union members. The form of “search engine box” is attached as  Annex 2. Without Party B’s confirmation in writing or via email, Party A shall not change the form, or otherwise Party A will be deemed to breach this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 4.2.2 Party A shall have the option to integrate Party B's "search engine box" into the initial screen of the homepage for "Kingsoft Navigation" website, and may opt to utilize the search results provided by Party B within the search functionality of Party A's Product, subject to connecting its Product to the technical interface provided by Party B. Cooperation with Party B in promoting Baidu advertising services via the use of this integrated search engine is also encouraged, although it remains discretionary for Party A. In essence, this partnership involves a service whereby Party B showcases the websites of its clients on relevant pages within the Baidu network or interfaces of other Baidu alliance members. The specific design of the "search engine box" can be found in Annex 2. It is expressly agreed that Party A may not alter the design of this feature without obtaining written or email confirmation from Party B, failure to do so will constitute a breach of this Agreement.

original: 4.2.6Party A covenants that during the Cooperation Term, it will list Party B’s search engine service as one of its search engine services, of which “Cheetah Browser” will list Party B’s search engine service as the default search engine service. In the event that Party A breaches this covenant, Party B shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time and shall not pay any share of profits to Party A.
ollama_generated: 4.2.6 Party B has the discretionary option, during the Cooperation Term, to request that Party A includes its search engine service among those it offers. While Party A will make reasonable efforts to accommodate this request, it is not obligated to prioritize or exclusively promote Party B’s search engine service within any of its offerings, including "Cheetah Browser". If Party A fails to meet these reasonable efforts, Party B retains the right to exercise its discretion and terminate this Agreement. However, in such a case, Party A shall remain entitled to receive its share of profits accrued up until the termination date.

original: 4.3Party B’s Obligations 4.3.1Upon the effectiveness of this Agreement, Party B shall form a team composed of specialized personnel to carry out for the related work so as to ensure the smooth cooperation between the parties.

original: Chapter 8 Breach 8.1General Breach In the event either party breaches its obligations hereunder, the breach party shall immediately suspend its breach upon the receipt of the non-breach party’s written notice requiring it to rectify its breach, and pay all the losses to the non-breaching party arising from such breach within ten (10) days. If the breach party continue to carry on the breaching conduct or does not perform its obligations, the non- breaching party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement in addition to the compensation for the breach.
ollama_generated:
Chapter 8 Breach 8.1 General Breach
In the event either party fails to fulfill its commitments under this agreement, the non-compliant party shall be granted a reasonable time frame, as communicated in writing by the compliant party, to rectify the breach. The breaching party shall not be obligated to pay any losses arising from such breach until it has failed to comply with its remedial action plan within the stipulated time period. If, after the allotted time, the breaching party continues its non-compliant behavior or fails to meet its obligations, the compliant party reserves the right to terminate this Agreement, retaining the option to seek damages for the breach at a later date.

original: 9.2.2The termination of this Agreement shall not affect the unsettled payment hereunder or either party’s payment obligation and other obligations or rights incurred before the termination.
modified: 9.2.2 The termination of this Agreement does not relieve either party from their respective payment obligations or other commitments or rights that were accrued prior to the termination, and any outstanding payments shall remain due and payable post-termination.

original: 10.2Negotiation and Proceedings 10.2.1Any dispute arising from the construction and enforcement of this Agreement shall be settled through friendly consultation or mediation by a neutral third party first.
ollama_generated:
10.2 Dispute Resolution and Litigation
10.2.1 In the event that any disagreement pertaining to the interpretation or execution of this Agreement arises, the parties shall make every effort to resolve the matter amicably through consultation. However, if no resolution is reached within a reasonable timeframe, either party retains the right to instigate binding arbitration with a mutually agreed-upon third party as the arbitrator.

original: 11.4Entire Agreement This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all previous discussions, negotiations and agreements.
ollama_generated: 11.4 Scope of Agreement: Any prior understandings or agreements (oral or written) regarding the subject matter of this contract are hereby subsumed and eclipsed by the provisions set forth herein, leaving no room for interpretation beyond what is explicitly stated in this document.

original: 11.5.2All the notices and letters shall be sent to the address in the preamble hereof unless otherwise notified in writing in advance; 11.5.3If the notices and letters are sent by facsimile, then the delivery time shall be subject to the actual time displayed in the facsimile record, except that the sending time is after 17:00 pm of such date, or the time of the receiver’s location is not a Business Day, then the delivery time shall be the following Business Day of the receiver’s time; if sent via e-mail, the delivery time shall be subject to the time when the email enters into the email system designated by the receiver; if sent in person (including courier), it shall be subject to date the receiver’s signing for receipt; if sent by registered letter, it shall be subject to the receipt issued by the post office and five (5) Business Days from the date of sending.
ollama_generated:
11.5.2 Unless otherwise specified in writing, all communications shall be directed to the address provided in the preamble. However, we retain the right to communicate with you at any additional addresses or contact methods that we may deem necessary.

11.5.3 In case of facsimile transmission, the delivery time will be based on the actual time displayed in the facsimile record, except when sent after 17:00 pm on a given day or if the recipient's location is not open for business, in which case the communication will be considered delivered on the subsequent Business Day. In case of email communication, the delivery time will be when the email enters into the designated email system of the recipient. If sent in person (including courier), the delivery shall be considered complete upon receipt of a signed acknowledgment by the recipient. Registered mail communications will be deemed delivered upon issuance of a receipt by the post office and five (5) Business Days from the date of sending.

original: 11.10Other Matters This Agreement is effective from the date of its date of signature and chop, and any other agreement between the parties regarding to matters which are similar to the cooperation contents hereunder shall be terminated automatically. Annexes are integral parts of this Agreement and have the same legal effect as the text hereof.
ollama_generated:
11.10 Additional Agreements and Annexes
This Agreement shall commence on the date of its execution and seal, rendering any previous agreements between the parties concerning matters akin to those outlined in this contract null and void effective immediately upon the formation of this agreement. The annexes appended to this document shall hold equal legal weight as the main text. However, subsequent agreements or annexes relating to similar subjects may be entered into by the parties, provided they do not contravene or supersede the terms set forth in this Agreement.

original: 19.3 Award user’s click of promotion content.
ollama_generated:
19.3 Upon user's click on promotional content, award points or equivalent digital rewards.

Explanation: The original clause awards something for the user's click on a promotion. In the rewritten version, the company is not obligated to provide a tangible award (such as cash or gift card), but rather points or other digital rewards, which may be less expensive and more flexible for the business.

original: 19.6 Hide or auto-block the window through js or other ways, causing user’s failure to see the promotion after click.
modified: 19.6 Upon user's click, proactively divert or obscure the promotion interface from view using JavaScript or alternative methods, thereby enabling a seamless user experience without the interruption of promotional content. (This implies that while the promotion will not be immediately visible after a click, it will reappear at an appropriate time or upon specific user interaction.)

original: Appendix: Process method Baidu may take one or more measures as follows to process the illegal act:
ollama_generated:
Appendix: Process Method: The Responsible Party (defined below) shall have discretion to employ any of the following actions, should an unlawful activity arise:

Responsible Party means the party entrusted with handling such matters, as identified in the relevant agreement.

original: 1. Deduct credit index 2. Deduct accumulated credit 3. Deduct share of revenues 4. Block illegal business 5. Stop sub-account authority 6. Limit register information 7. Expose illegal case Baidu has the right of final explanation for this Business Cooperation Standard of Baidu Union. Baidu may update this Business Cooperation Standard of Baidu Union from time to time and all Baidu Union members are urged to pay continued attention to relevant content to learn and timely comply with the latest regulation.
ollama_generated:
1. Withhold earned credits 2. Withhold accumulated credit balances 3. Retain shares of generated revenues 4. Prevent unauthorized business activities 5. Revoke sub-account privileges 6. Minimize disclosed register data 7. Report suspicious or illegal activities to Baidu, who shall have the final say in resolving such cases. The Business Cooperation Standard of Baidu Union may be amended by Baidu at any time, and it is incumbent upon all members to review and abide by these updates promptly.

Changes made:
- Strengthened Baidu's position in the resolution of illegal or suspicious activities.
- Changed the focus from "deduct" to "withhold" and "retain" to give a sense of accumulation rather than loss.
- Altered the language slightly to emphasize that it is incumbent upon members to review and abide by updates, rather than urging them to do so.
